description: The OpenMP Architecture Review Board announced from SC24 that OpenMP 6.0 is now available as a major upgrade to the OpenMP specification for multi-process programming within C / C++ / Fortran. A big emphasis on OpenMP 6.0 is making it easier for developers to embrace...
title: OpenMP 6.0 Released With An Emphasis On Easier Parallel Programming

description: A new patch series posted today to the Linux kernel mailing list would block kernel modules/drivers from TUXEDO Computers from accessing GPL-only symbols in the kernel...
title: Upstream Linux Developers Take Aim At TUXEDO's Out-Of-Tree GPLv3 Drivers

description: While it's difficult still finding Intel Xeon 6 "Granite Rapids" motherboards/servers widely available at Internet retailers/distributors, when it comes to the AMD EPYC 9005 "Turin" processors that launched just last month, there is better availability thanks in large part to leveraging the existing SP5 socket. For those wanting to assemble a single socket AMD EPYC 9005 series server, one of the readily available options in the retail channel is the Supermicro H13SSL-N motherboard.
title: Supermicro H13SSL-N For AMD EPYC 9005 "Turin" 1P Servers

description: The first public beta of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10 (RHEL 10) was released on Wednesday with a wide variety of new/updated packages, new features, and other changes over RHEL 9...
title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10 Enters Beta With Many New Features & Updates

description: Last month AMD Linux engineers posted patches for a 3D V-Cache Optimizer driver for Linux that allows the user to communicate their cache vs. frequency preference depending upon workload and for the 3D V-Cache processors where some CCDs have the larger cache but not all. That driver is now ready for appearing in the upcoming Linux 6.13 kernel...
title: AMD 3D V-Cache Optimizer Driver To Be Merged For Linux 6.13

description: A patch queued yesterday ino the Linux power management subsystem's "linux-next" branch ahead of the upcoming Linux 6.13 merge window will tune Intel Xeon Granite Rapids processors for better performance out-of-the-box...
title: Linux 6.13 To Tune Intel Granite Rapids For Better Performance Out-Of-The-Box

description: Linux 6.10 introduced TPM bus encryption and integrity protection for enhancing the Trusted Platform Module support to protect against interposers from compromising them with TPM sniffing attacks. There is now a new option being added to opt-out of this protection due to a discovered performance bottleneck...
title: Linux To Allow Disabling TPM PCR Integrity Protection Due To Performance Bottleneck

description: The newest Linux driver being developed by Intel is for the Touch Host Controller (THC) as a new high performance input tech for enhancing touch screen, touch pad, and stylus input handling...
title: Intel Touch Host Controller "THC" Driver Support Being Worked On For Linux

description: Ahead of the expected final Linux 6.12 stable kernel release this weekend, a last round of Bcachefs file-system fixes were submitted today for this next kernel version...
title: Bcachefs Squeezes More Fixes Into Linux 6.12
